KPK Belum Terima Salinan Putusan Lengkap Vonis Bebas Sofyan Basir
05 Nov 2019, 22:27 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Belum Terima Salinan Putusan Lengkap Vonis Bebas Sofyan Basir

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) hingga saat ini mengaku belum menerima salinan putusan lengkap atas nama terdakwa Sofyan Basir. Yang dimaksud salinan lengkap adalah pernyataan dari Pengadilan pihak Pemgadikan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) Jakarta yang menyatakan Sofyan Basir divonis bebas karena tidak terbukti bersalah melakukan perbuatan melanggar atau melawan hukum.
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta menuelaskab bahwa terkait dengan apa yang dilakukan oleh KPK untuk persiapan melakukan upaya hukum terhadap putusan bebas dengan terdakwa Sofyan Basir.
”Sampai saat ini kami (KPK) belum menerima salinan putusan lengkap secara resmi dari pengadilan," kata Febri Diansyah di Gedung KPK, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11:2019).
Febri mengatakan  bahwa KPK berencana menyiapkan upaya hukum berikutnya pascaputusan bebas Sofyan tersebut.
“Kami juga tidak boleh berpangku tangan sehingga kami juga mencermati catatan-catatan yang kami lakukan dan kami simpan saat pembacaan putusan secara lisan oleh majelis hakim," kata Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta.
Febri memastikan bahwa KPK mulai mengidentifikasi karena terdapat beberapa poin yang cukup krusial yang belum dipertimbangkan oleh majelis hakim terhadap putusan vonis bebas terdakwa Sofyan Basir terkait kasus dugaan perkara suap proyek pembangunan Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Uap (PLTU) Riau-1.
Febri menjelaskan, salah satu yang cukup krusial terkait dengan pertanyaan apakah terdakwa Sofyan Basir mengetahui atau tidak mengetahui adanya praktik suap yang diterima oleh Eni M. Saragih.
Eni yang saat itu diketahui masih menjabat sebagai Wakil Ketua Komisi VII Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah (DPR) RI diduga telah menerima uang suap sebesar Rp4,7 miliar bersama dengan pihak lain.
Uang suap itu menurut KPK diduga merupakan pemberiaan dari tersangka Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo. Yang bersangkutan diekerahui merupakan pemegang atau pemilik saham mayoritas Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd
“KPK juga memandang ada bukti-bukti lain yang belum dipertimbangkan oleh majelis hakim terkait dengan adanya dugaan keterlibatan Sofyan Basir dalam kasus ini” pugkas Febri Diansyah.

KPK Has Not Received A Copy of the Complete Decision on Sofyan Basir's Free Verdict
05 Nov 2019, 22:27 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Has Not Received A Copy of the Complete Decision on Sofyan Basir's Free Verdict

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) have so far claimed that they have not received a copy of the complete decision on behalf of defendant Sofyan Basir. What is meant by the complete copy is a statement from the Jakarta Corruption Court (Tipikor) Court which states Sofyan Basir was acquitted because he was not proven guilty of committing an act of violating or against the law.
KPK's Public Relations Head, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta to explain that related to what was done by the KPK in preparation for legal action against the acquittal with the defendant Sofyan Basir.
"Until now we (the KPK) have not received a copy of the complete decision officially from the court," said Febri Diansyah at the KPK Building, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5: 2019).
Febri said that the KPK plans to prepare the next legal remedy after Sofyan's free decision.
"We also cannot stand by so we also pay close attention to the records that we do and we keep when reading verdicts verbally by the judges," Febri Diansyah told reporters in Jakarta.
Febri confirmed that the Corruption Eradication Commission began to identify because there were some crucial points which had not been considered by the panel of judges regarding the verdict of the defendant Sofyan Basir's decision regarding the alleged bribery case of the Riau-1 Steam Power Plant construction project.
Febri explained, one that was quite crucial was related to the question whether the defendant Sofyan Basir knew or did not know of the practice of bribery that was accepted by Eni M. Saragih.
Eni, who was known to be still serving as Deputy Chairperson of Commission VII of the Indonesian Regional House of Representatives (DPR), was alleged to have received a bribe of Rp. 4.7 billion along with other parties.
The bribe, according to the KPK, was allegedly the liaison of the suspect Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo. The person concerned is the holder or majority shareholder of Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd
"The KPK also considers that there is other evidence which has not been considered by the panel of judges related to the alleged involvement of Sofyan Basir in this case," said Febri Diansyah.
